dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: 87 billion dollars in sales—that's what Amazon is expected to report this week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: eighty seven billion dollars in sales-that's what Amazon is expected to report this week.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is expected to report $86 billion in sales and earnings per share of $4.05, and Tesla is expected to bring in $7.05 billion in revenue and earnings of $1.65 per share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and Tesla's looking at over 7 billion in revenue, but honestly, the coronavirus is just overshadowing everything right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and Tesla's looking at over seven billion in revenue, but honestly, the coronavirus is just overshadowing everything right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Amazon is expected to report $86 billion in sales and earnings per share of $4.05, and Tesla is expected to bring in $7.05 billion in revenue and earnings of $1.65 per share.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: It's crazy, like, the Dow had its worst drop since October, down one and a half percent on Monday alone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's crazy, like, the Dow had its worst drop since October, down one and a half percent on Monday alone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The S&P 500 was down 1.6%, the Nasdaq Composite index 1.9% and the Dow Jones industrial average 1.5%. It was the Dows worst single-day drop since October 2, 2019, the S&Ps since October 8, 2019, and the Nasdaqs since August 23, 2019, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And that lockdown in China—almost 50 million people affected during Lunar New Year, which is just devastating for tourism and consumer demand.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And that lockdown in China-almost fifty million people affected during Lunar New Year, which is just devastating for tourism and consumer demand.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The spreading virus is already having an impact on consumer demand and tourism during the busy Lunar New Year period (almost 50 million people and more than a dozen cities are currently on lockdown), and U.S. companies with businesses in China are not exempt from the pain as some have already closed stores in the region.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge called it an added headwind at a time when stocks are already super sensitive.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Adam Crisafulli from Vital Knowledge called it an added headwind at a time when stocks are already super sensitive.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Making things even riskier for investors is a market thats trading at unsustainable valuations, according to Adam Crisafulli, founder of Vital Knowledge, who says that the coronavirus is acting as an added headwind at a time when stocks are becoming extraordinarily sensitive to even the smallest setbacks.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and you've got companies like Starbucks, Apple, all reporting this week, but investors are just selling first and asking questions later.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and you've got companies like Starbucks, Apple, all reporting this week, but investors are just selling first and asking questions later.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Its a huge week for earnings with Apple, Starbucks, Facebook, Amazon and others all reporting, even as investors grapple with the financial fallout from the deadly coronavirus. Although historically these outbreaks have been buying opportunities, the bottom line is investors are taking a sell first and ask questions later approach right now.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly, Ryan Detrick from LPL Financial said hopes for containment were squashed over the weekend.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly, Ryan Detrick from L P L Financial said hopes for containment were squashed over the weekend.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hopes that the virus would be contained were squashed over the weekend, says Ryan Detrick, senior market strategist for LPL Financial.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And crude oil hit a three-month low too, West Texas Intermediate down to like, what, 53 dollars a barrel?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And crude oil hit a three-month low too, West Texas Intermediate down to like, what, fifty three dollars a barrel?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Crude oil prices also hit a three-month low on Monday, with U.S. West Texas Intermediate falling to $53 per barrel.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, it's a perfect storm—high valuations, no vaccine in sight, and now this outbreak.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, it's a perfect storm-high valuations, no vaccine in sight, and now this outbreak.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But Chris Zaccarelli compared it to SARS—the S&P dropped 11% but then finished the year up 19%.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Chris Zaccarelli compared it to S A R S-the S&P dropped eleven percent but then finished the year up nineteen percent.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Zaccarelli compares the coronavirus with the SARS outbreak: During the five-month period starting in mid-November 2002 until mid-March 2003, the S&P 500 dropped 12% but ended up actually finishing that year 19% higher than where it started, he notes.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: So he thinks it might actually be a buying opportunity in the medium term?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So he thinks it might actually be a buying opportunity in the medium term?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, over the medium term, this will likely prove to be a buying opportunity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: That's what he's predicting, though short-term, it's definitely painful for the global economy.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: That's what he's predicting, though short-term, it's definitely painful for the global economy.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Chinese economyand possibly the world economywill take a hit in the short run, and lower prices are a rational response to the increasing spread of the coronavirus, predicts Chris Zaccarelli, chief investment officer for the Independent Advisor Alliance.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Especially for airlines, casinos—anyone with exposure to China is feeling it right now.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Especially for airlines, casinos-anyone with exposure to China is feeling it right now.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Hotels, airlines, cruise and casino operators, big retailers and consumer goods companies have all so far been affected by the financial impact of the coronavirus.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: It's just wild how quickly things shifted from earnings focus to pure virus panic.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's just wild how quickly things shifted from earnings focus to pure virus panic.
